article.title: Vaidya Spacetime in Massive Gravity's Rainbow

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the plot in Figure 1 illustrate about massive gravity\'s rainbow?
choices: The tendency to form black holes increases with increasing α.
The spacetime is not energy dependent.
The significance of α is more pronounced in the later stages of the universe\'s evolution.
The a dependence of the system is more significant in the earlier than in the later stages of the evolution of the universe.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend does Figure 2 show in massive gravity\'s rainbow?
choices: As the values of β increase, the trajectories push downwards towards the k-axis, indicating an increased tendency to form black holes.
The trajectories remain in the negative Xo region, indicating black hole formation.
The value of β has negligible impact on the system\'s evolution.
Increasing the value of β consistently leads to the formation of naked singularities.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 analyzes the impact of γ on black hole formation in massive gravity\'s rainbow. What is the key observation?
choices: The value of γ has no discernible impact on the system\'s evolution.
Lower values of γ consistently lead to naked singularity formation.
The tendency to form a black hole increases with an increase in the value of γ.
The trajectories always remain in the negative X0 region, indicating black hole formation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What specific rainbow functions, F(E) and G(E), are used in the numerical analysis of this paper and are motivated by previous research [5, 9]?
